snippet: Pope Francis replaced all but one of the appointees made by his predecessor, Benedict XVI, in another example of how the new pope is consolidating power.
abstract: Pope Francis continues shaking up Vatican as he names new cardinals to an oversight commission for the troubled Vatican Bank, replacing all but one of the appointees made by his predecessor, Benedict XVI; move is seen as signal that he intends to crack down on intrigues and disarray that have plagued Vatican bureaucracy and offers another example of how he is seeking to consolidate power.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and GAIA PIANIGIANI

lead_paragraph: Pope Francis replaced all but one of the appointees made by his predecessor, Benedict XVI, in another example of how the new pope is consolidating power.

headline.main: Pope Names Cardinals to Oversee Vatican Bank
headline.print_headline: Pope Names Cardinals to Oversee Troubled Vatican Bank
